meanings.definition: The state of feeling nauseous or sick.
meanings.sent1: Her queasiness after the roller coaster ride made her pale.
meanings.sent2: The queasiness in his stomach told him he shouldn't have eaten so much candy.
meanings.sent3: The queasiness from eating too many sweets was a lesson learned.
meanings.sent4: The queasiness of fear gripped her as she stood on the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The queasiness of motion sickness on the boat was unbearable.

meanings.definition: A feeling of discomfort or unease.
meanings.sent1: The queasiness in the room made her want to leave.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't shake off the queasiness in his mind about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The queasiness of embarrassment flushed her cheeks.
meanings.sent4: The queasiness of uncertainty gnawed at him all day.
meanings.sent5: The queasiness of guilt weighed heavily on her conscience.
